title: An Improved Tur\'an Exponent for 2-Complexes
abstract:
The topological Tur\'an number $\mathrm{ex}_{\hom}(n,X)$ of a 2-dimensional
simplicial complex $X$ asks for the maximum number of edges in an $n$-vertex
3-uniform hypergraph containing no triangulation of $X$ as a subgraph. We prove
that the Tur\'an exponent of any such space $X$ is at most $8/3$, i.e., that
$\mathrm{ex}_{\hom}(n,X)\leq Cn^{8/3}$ for some constant $C=C(X)$. This
improves on the previous exponent of $3-1/5$, due to Keevash, Long, Narayanan,
and Scott. Additionally, we present new streamlined proofs of the
asymptotically tight upper bounds for the topological Tur\'an numbers of the
torus and real projective plane, which can be used to derive asymptotically
tight upper bounds for all surfaces.
